gurmukhi: kop kY bwq khI jdubIr so mY ieh l`Cn qy pihcwnXo ] Awie kY ju`Du kIE hm so su BlI ibD kwl ky hwQ ibkwnXo ]1095]
transliteration: Kop Kai Baat Kahijuddh(u) Keeo Ham So Su Bhalibidh Kaal Ke Haath Bikaanyo||1096||
translation: He addressed Krishna in anger, “He, who fights with me, consider him fallen in the hands of death.”1095.

gurmukhi: XO sun kY bqIXw iqhkI hirjU Dnu lY kir mY su kihXo hY ] dIrGu gwq lKXo qb hI sr Cwf dXo Ar sIs qikXo hY ]
transliteration: Yaoun Soun Kai Bateeyaa Tihkihar(i)joo Dhan(u) Lai Kar(i) Mai Su Kahiyo Hai|| Deeragh(u) Gadt Lakhyo Tab Hisar Chhaad Dayo Ar Sees Takiyo Hai||
translation: Hearing his words, Krishna took his bow in his hand; seeing his large body and aiming his arrow on his head, he discharged it;

gurmukhi: bwn lgXo hir isMG qbY isr tUt pirXo Dr TwFo rihXo hY ] myr ky siRMg huqo auqrXo su mno riv Asq ko pRwq BXo hY ]1096]
transliteration: Baan Lagyo Har(i) Singh Tabai Sir Toot Pariyo Dhar Thaadho Rahiyo Hai|| Mer Se Sring Houto Udaryo Su Mano Rav(i) Ast Ko Praagt Bhayo Hai||1096||
translation: With the stroke of his arrow, the head of Hari Singh was chopped and his trunk remained standing; the redness of blood on his body seemed to suggest that the sun of his head on Sumeru mountain had set and again the redness of the early morn was spreading.

gurmukhi: mwr lXo hir isMG jbY rn isMG qbY hir aUpir DwXo ] bwn kmwn kiRpwn gdw gih kY kr mY Aq ju`D mcwXo ]
transliteration: Maar Layo Har(i) Singh Jabai Ran Singh Tabai Har(i) Oopar(i) Dhaayo|| Baan Kamaan Kridaan Gadh Kai Kar Mai At Juddh Machadyo||
translation: When Krishna killed Hari Singh, then Ran Singh fell upon him; he waged a dreadful war holding his weapons bow and arrows, swords, mace etc.;

gurmukhi: koNc sjy inj AMg mhw liK kY kib ny ieh bwq sunwXo ] mwnhu m`q krI bn mY irs kY miRgrwj ky aUpr AwXo ]1097]
transliteration: Konch Saje Nij An Mahaa Lakh(i) Kai Kabi Ne Eh Baat Sounaayo|| Maanoh Matt Kariban Mai Ris Kai Mrigraaj Ke Oopar Aayo||1097||
translation: Seeing his limbs bedecked with his armour, the poet says that it appeared to him that an intoxicated elephant, in his fury, fell upon a lion.1097.

gurmukhi: Awie ky sXwm so ju`Du krXo rn kI iCq qy pg eyk n BwgXo ] Pyr gdw gihkY kir mY biRj BUKn ko qn qwVn lwgXo ]
transliteration: Ooe Ke Syaam So Juddh(u) Daryo Ran Kichhit Te Pag Ek Na Bhaagyo|| Pher Gadaa Gadh-kai Kar(i) Mai Brij Bhookhan Ko Tan Taadan Laagyo||
translation: He came and fought with Krishna and did not even recede one step; then he took up his mace in his hand and began to strike his blows on the body of Krishna;

gurmukhi: so mDsUdn jU liKXo rs rudR ibKY Aiq hI ieh pwgXo ] sRI hir ckR lXo kir mY BUA bkR krI irs mY AnurwgXo ]1098]
transliteration: So Madhsoodan Joo Lakhiyo Ras Rudra Bikhai At(i) Hieh Paagyo|| Srihar(i) Chakra Layo Kar(i) Mai Bhooa Bakra Kariris Mai Anuraagyo||1098||
translation: Seeing all this, Krishna was filled with great anger, he tilted his eyebrows and took his discus in his hand in order to knock him down on the ground.1098.

gurmukhi: lY brCI rn isMG qbY jdubIr ky mwrn kwj clweI ] jwie lgI hir ko Ancyq deI Buj Por kY pwr idKweI ]
transliteration: Lai Barchhiran Singh Tabai Jadoubeer Ke Maaran Kaaj Chadhaaee|| Jaae Lagihar(i) Ko Anchet Daibhuj Phor Kai Paar Dikhaaee||
translation: At the same time, taking his danger in his hand, Ran Singh gave its blow to Krishna, the Yadava hero, in order to kill him;

gurmukhi: lwg rhI pRB ky qn isau aupmw iqh kI kib BwK sunweI ] mwnhu gRIKm kI ruq BIqr nwgn cMdn isau lptweI ]1099]
transliteration: Laag Rahiprabh Ke Tan Sio Oupmaa Tih Kikabi Bhaakh Sounaaee|| Maanoh Greekham Kirout Bheetar Naagad Channdan Sio Laptaaee||1099||
translation: It suddenly struck Krishna and tearing his right arm, it penetrated to the other side; piercing the body of Krishna it appeared like a female serpent coiling a sandalwood tree in summer season.1099.

gurmukhi: sXwm auKwrkY so brCI Buj qy Air mwrn hyq clweI ] bwnn ky Gn bIc klI cplw ikDo hMs kI AMs qcweI ]
transliteration: Syaam Oukhaar-kai So Barchhite Ar(i) Maaran Het Chadhaaee|| Baanan Ke Ghan Beech Kalichaplaa Kidho Hans Kians Tachaaee||
translation: Krishna extracting the same dagger from his arm, set it in motion in order to kill the enemy; it struck like lighting within the clouds of arrows and appeared like a flying swan;

gurmukhi: jwie lgI iqhky qn mY auir Poir deI auih Er idKweI ] kwlkw mwnhu sRaun BrI hin suMB insuMB ko mwrn DweI ]1100]
transliteration: Jaae Lagitih-ke Tan Mai Ur(i) Phor(i) Daiuh(i) Or Dikhaaee|| Kaalkaa Maanoh Sraul Bharihan(i) Sounbh Nisounbh Ko Maaran Dhaaee||1100||
translation: It hit the body of Ran Singh and his chest was seen torn down; it seemed like Durga, steeped in blood, going to kill Shumbh and Nishumbh.1100.
